intro: Wulfenia cordata, commonly known as the narrowleaf wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Wulfenia cordata is known for its delicate blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer.
